purpleculture_examples:
资源 [ zī yuán ]: Ziyuan county in Guilin 桂林 , Guangxi
资源 [ zī yuán ]: natural resource (such as water or minerals); resource (such as manpower or tourism)
能源 [ néng yuán ]: energy; power source; Classifiers: 个
来源 [ lái yuán ]: source (of information etc); origin

purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 氵 [ shuǐ ] water
    • 原 [ yuán ] source, origin, beginning
heisig_chinese_memo: The source of the water lies beyond the flatlands.
heisig_constituent: source, water, water droplets, water pistol, meadow, cliff, sun, day, small, little
heisig_story: With the advice of the last frame in mind, it is easy to see water and meadow in this character for source. Both in its etymology (it has a common parent with the word "surge") and in popular usage, source suggests the place water comes from. In this kanji, it is under the meadow, where we just saw it breaking the surface in those bubbly little springs.
koohiiStory1: The water that flows from the meadow is the source of life for the wild antelope.
koohiiStory2: The source of clean water is from the meadow (#134): it comes from that spring at the bottom of the cliff. Pay no attention to Julie Andrews lying face down in spring. The water´s clean. Trust me.
jp_example_words:
起源(きげん): origin, beginning, rise
語源(ごげん): word root, word derivation, etymology
財源(ざいげん): source of funds, resources, finances
水源(すいげん): source of river, fountainhead
電源(でんげん): source of electricity, power (button on TV etc.)
源(みなもと): source, origin
資源(しげん): resources
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The original tsunami was the origin of Japan. A big tsunami came and uncovered the islands of Japan. It's the origin of all life, as far as Japanese people are concerned.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture the original tsunami used in the origin story of Japan. It was huge. Bigger than anything you've ever seen. And without it you wouldn't have your precious anime and mangos.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: This tsunami was also the origin of Genji (げん), from "The Tale of Genji." Just think, without this origin, Japan wouldn't exist and neither would the first Japanese heartthrob, Genji!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: The origin of Genji was the origin of all Japan: a big ol' tsunami.
Ru_Radicals: 厂 (скала), 小 (маленький), 汁 (суп), 白 (белый)
Ru_trainchinese: yuán: (графема) исток реки; источник, происхождение
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the water (氵) in the meadow (原) comes from a source
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The source of the water lies beyond the flatlands.

源字的基本解释

源
yuán
水流所从出的地方：河源。泉源。发源。源远流长。源头。
事物的根由：来源。资源。渊源。能源。起源。策源地。
姓。
流

源字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yuán］
［《廣韻》愚袁切，平元，疑。］
“厵1”的今字。
(1)水流始出处。
(2)来源；根源。
(3)探察本源。
(4)姓。北魏有源贺。见《魏书》本传。

源字的英文翻译

◎ 源
fountain, fountainhead

源字的康熙字典解释

【巳集上】【水字部】　源； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页639第16
【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】?愚袁切，音元。【說文】水泉本也。【禮·月令】爲民祈祀山川百源。【註】衆水始出爲百源。　又水名。【水經注】沁水東與丹水合，水出上黨高都縣故城東北阜下，俗謂之源源水。　又姓。【北魏書·源賀傳】禿髮傉檀之子賀入後魏，魏大武謂之曰：與卿同源，可爲源氏。　【韻會】本作厵，篆省作原。

源字的源字形

源字的起名意思

：源字的本义是指水源,源泉。指水流的起始处，引申为来历、根由，达源。

[①]［yuán］
["Guang Yun" Yu Yuan Qi, Ping Yuan, doubt. ]

[Guang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting]? Yu Yuan cut, phoneme. [Said the text] Shuiquan also. 【Rite·Moon Order】Pray for the people to worship the mountains and rivers. [Note] All water is a source of water.　Also known as water. [Notes on Water Classics] Qinshui East and Dan hydrate together, and the water flows out of Fuxia in the northeast of the old city of Shangdang Gaodu County, which is commonly known as the source water.　Another last name. [Book of Northern Wei Dynasty·Yuanhe Biography] The son of the bald-haired Li Tan He entered the post-Wei Dynasty. . 山 r 科 i :
Зная слово.
От? (水), что означает место, где начинается поток воды; от оригинала, который является исходным символом источника, надпись подобна воде, вытекающей из каменной пещеры, указывая на начало потока; оригинал (юань) также выражает звук.
Первоначальное значение - источник воды.
①Место, где начинается течение воды: ~ tou | ~ 流 | ~ далеко и долго.
2 Источник или происхождение вещей: товары ~ "капитал ~ | открытое ~ дросселирование".

Radicals: 氵, 原  (tsunami, original)
Meaning Mnemonic
The original tsunami was the origin of Japan. A big tsunami came and uncovered the islands of Japan. It's the origin of all life, as far as Japanese people are concerned.
Picture the original tsunami used in the origin story of Japan. It was huge. Bigger than anything you've ever seen. And without it you wouldn't have your precious anime and mangos.
Reading Mnemonic
This tsunami was also the origin of Genji (げん), from "The Tale of Genji." Just think, without this origin, Japan wouldn't exist and neither would the first Japanese heartthrob, Genji!
The origin of Genji was the origin of all Japan: a big ol' tsunami.
